#summary AiBridge - Manifest file

= AndroidManifest =

Every application must have an AndroidManifest.xml file (with precisely that name) in its root directory. The manifest presents essential information about the application to the Android system, information the system must have before it can run any of the application's code.


= Code Example =

Here is a simple example of an Android Manifest file. For detailed info, please see here: http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/manifest/manifest-intro.html

<code>
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>

<!-- *************************** THIS IS PRO VERSION  *********************** -->

<manifest xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
          package="com.gooyatech.rapidlovesmspro"
          android:versionCode="8"
          android:versionName="1.8">

    <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.SEND_SMS"/>
    <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.INTERNET"/>
    <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.VIBRATE"/>
    <!--<uses-permission android:name="android.permission.RECEIVE_SMS"/>-->
    <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.READ_CONTACTS"/>
    <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION"/>
    <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.READ_PHONE_STATE"/>

    <uses-sdk android:minSdkVersion="5" android:targetSdkVersion="13" />


    <!--we use resizeable=false, because we want the app to run in screen compatibility mode
        http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/manifest/supports-screens-element.html#resizeable
    -->
    <supports-screens android:resizeable="false"
                      android:smallScreens="true"
                      android:normalScreens="true"
                      android:largeScreens="true"
                      xlargeScreens="true"/>

    <application android:label="Rapid Love SMS - PRO" android:icon="@drawable/rapidlovesmspro">
        <activity android:name=".activities.SplashActivity" android:label="@string/app_name">
            <intent-filter>
                <action android:name="android.intent.action.MAIN"/>
                <category android:name="android.intent.category.LAUNCHER"/>
            </intent-filter>
        </activity>

        <activity android:name=".activities.RapidLoveSmsActivity" android:label="@string/app_name"/>
        <activity android:name=".activities.CloseAppActivity" android:label="@string/app_name"/>

        <!-- Activity neded for ListPicker -->
        <!--<activity android:name="com.google.devtools.simple.runtime.components.android.ListPickerActivity" android:theme="@android:style/Theme.Dialog.Alert"  android:screenOrientation="behind" android:configChanges="keyboardHidden|orientation">-->
        <activity android:name="com.google.devtools.simple.runtime.components.android.ListPickerActivity"
                  android:theme="@style/Theme.Amerkashi"
                  android:screenOrientation="behind"
                  android:configChanges="keyboardHidden|orientation">
        </activity>


        <activity android:name="com.google.devtools.simple.runtime.components.android.WebViewActivity"
                  android:screenOrientation="behind"
                  android:configChanges="keyboardHidden|orientation" >
            <intent-filter>
                <action android:name="android.intent.action.MAIN"/>
            </intent-filter>
        </activity>


    </application>
</manifest> 

</code>
